website_summaries.verdict: This built-in jack is good for smaller trailers, although some note that even then it's not the strongest option.
pros: Comes with mounting hardware and grease fittings
Travels from 12.7 inches retracted to 22.7 inches extended
cons: Some buyers say that this jack failed or seized up within a year
Jack overall doesn't seem as sturdy as other options

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended
customer_reviews.text: The warranty states 5 years and my unit seized up after 3 years and would not go up or down. Fitting was lubed properly. I tried calling the Fulton 800 number for warranty and nobody answered after 45 minutes on hold. I noticed other Reviewers had the same issue. I would not recommend this boat trailer swivel to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: JNick

customer_reviews.title: Used this to replace the the swivel foot on my 'dirty hand tools' log splitter.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace the the swivel foot on my 'dirty hand tools' log splitter. It IS NOT a direct fit in that application (nor does it claim to be), but it's the closest fitting model available. The hub size and the snap-ring are a perfect match, but the holes for the pull-pin to drop into on the trailer plate need to be enlarged in the direction of the hub. I used a grinding wheel on my dremel and greased everything thoroughly afterwards. Worked great! The quality of the wheel and jack itself is very good. I tried the Reese first ,and it was junk in comparison (and didn't line up as closely)
customer_reviews.author: NetMagi

customer_reviews.title: It seems sturdier than one that was on my shorelander ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems sturdier than one that was on my shorelander trailer, in the one that was on it was a Folton but only had an 800 lbs. capacity. Only took about 30 minutes to remove and install with an air impact gun. Hardest part was trying get the big snap or "C" ring off. And it has a grease fitting on the crank area. Haven't had a chance to really use it have to get a hitch on my vehicle. Will update later. I have an 18 ft 2700 lbs. Bow Rider.
customer_reviews.author: Kattie O.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and plenty strong.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an existing jack that I bent. Just used the bolt plate and installed on other side of frame. Seems very sturdy and easy to install. Bolt plate has a lip at bottom of plate for frame to rest on so seems it should last forever. Also really appreciate having the crank at the top rather than on the side. Much easier to use. Used on a smallish Coleman pop up camper.
customer_reviews.author: cheyenne guillois

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality...and a trusted brand!
customer_reviews.text: Our old trailer tongue hack got bent so we replaced it with the same Fulton brand so it would be easier to install. It is of good quality, Both the release handle for the wheel amd the main stand and wheel are all very sturdy. Our previous stand didn't have a wheel. Not sure why we waited so long to convert over to the wheel style. Sure makes things so much easier! Very good quality product, packaged well and prompt delivery as well. Happy customer!!
customer_reviews.author: AH-Rancho Cucamonga, Ca

customer_reviews.title: Siezed up in less than 9 months.
customer_reviews.text: Product looks good and works well for a short time. However, it has been less than 9 months since purchase and it has completely locked up. I cannot raise or lower the jack height. This jack has seen very light use and been rinsed after every trip. Look elsewhere if you expect more than a 9 month lifespan from your jack.
customer_reviews.author: M Damon Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for on old seized jack.
customer_reviews.text: Great direct replacement for an integrated jack on a Shorelandr boat trailer. Contacted Fulton and confirmed this was the correct model but on arrival it has a universal mounting bracket. Removed the mounting plate (one large spring circlip) and it bolted up perfectly. If you intend to do the same, make sure you have a pair of circlip pliers, would be a real bugger to remove the universal mount plate otherwise. Nice that the new one has zerk grease fittings and seems to be made of slightly better materials than the original (from 2001).
customer_reviews.author: RMC_SS_LDO

customer_reviews.title: Trailer jack
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the quality of the trailer jack I ordered. Simple installation, requiring only a snap ring tool. The wheel on the jack is sturdy and it swivels smoothly allowing for a easy connection to my trailer. Only problem I experienced was finding my snap ring tool! When I am ready for another jack on my other trailer I will be buying a Fulton again.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Betts

customer_reviews.title: Cheap as it can be made but still look like a Jack!
customer_reviews.text: Fulton should be ashamed of how cheap the Chinese out sourcing has made they're products. I replaced a 15 year old 600lb Fulton Jack that had frozen up and decided to upgrade it with they're 1200lb Jack on a 20' boat. No Problem, The tongue weight is 200lbs. While sitting on the grass at home I climbed in and walked to the bow and the Jack buckled and collapsed on day 2. I'm thankful for Amazons great return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Craptastic bracket
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this back in May and installed it on my enclosed utility trailer over Memorial Day weekend. I didn't have a need to move the trailer until yesterday (7/13/2013), and when I did, the bracket bent all to hell to the point that it wasn't useable or safe. Even though I was technically outside the 30 day return window, when I called Amazon, they were great and processed the return anyway. I replaced it with a 1500lb Mighty Wheel Jack from Bass Pro Shops with a nice, wide, 4" wheel, that works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Weiner

customer_reviews.title: Typical TongueJack
customer_reviews.text: Okay quality. I’ve had several over the years and wish someone would make a high end quality heavyweight jack, but until then we get by. This unit instanced easily enough. No complications. I wish the unit had more drop down length to it, but I compensate with blocks.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Davison

customer_reviews.title: Good heavy duty trailer jack
customer_reviews.text: I had a Trailer Valet on my trailer I was hoping would help me move my boat around my marl driveway but would just dig holes in the marl (worked great on asphalt or concrete; just not marl or gravel). The Trailer Valet was a little involved when it came time to couple or uncouple from my truck's hitch. Given the lack of benefit and the extra effort it cost, I went looking for an easier answer. This Fulton jack fits the bill. It's heavy duty, rolls the trailer into final position even when fully extended... in short does everything you'd ask of a trailer jack. I'd buy another without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Hanig

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great product so far. Put this on the trailer that hauls my 17' tracker walk through windshield and no issues. Even with the trailer parked on slight sideways angle it hasn't given me issues. If I run into any I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: James Brevick

customer_reviews.title: Great Trailer Jack
customer_reviews.text: This is the first review I've ever written. This jack was a nice upgrade and easy to install on my Big Tex trailer. Makes it much easier to push this double ATV trailer around. I can pre-load the ATV's the night before, back the truck up in the morning, and without a spotter, hook it up, because I can maneuver it over the ball. Components are heavy duty, the swivel works great, locks securely, and the heavy zinc finish will keep it from rusting. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Fsonjay

customer_reviews.title: Beefy Tongue Jack
customer_reviews.text: A little more rugged than the broken 1000 lb capacity it is replacing. The mounting bolt pattern did not match, but it has a tongue clamp-around system I was able to make work. The old one lasted 22 years and only broke due to inattentiveness, so I think I'm set for life.
customer_reviews.author: Vilnis Neilands

customer_reviews.title: Functions as its intended to.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy construction. I initially placed the bolts in the reverse direction and this prevented the swivel movement necessary for operation of the stand. A clear bond warning In re this issue should be on the install instruction
customer_reviews.author: Ronald G. Desnoyers

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: I am fine with it but it requires constant tightening. Great value overall.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Last 6 months in a saltwater environment, But works ...
customer_reviews.text: Last 6 months in a saltwater environment, But works flawlessly until your handle gets stuck and breaks.. Key Word~ Grease It on a regular basis
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Mine must be a dud. I hope the replacement will be better.
customer_reviews.text: One star for the jack (locked up mid-stroke after just two months / about three dozen uses, despite lube, etc.), two stars for the manufacturer (can't repair it / do anything, but we'll replace it once you send it in), five stars for Amazon (we're sending a replacement immediately, and here's a return shipping label for the bad one).
customer_reviews.author: CMM

customer_reviews.title: Holding up well after five boating seasons.
customer_reviews.text: After the original jack gave out on my Hoss trailer, I tried a couple of el cheapass jacks from Harbor Freight. Well, you get what you pay for. Those failed after a year or so. Hence investing in and being happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Nice and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Nice and inexpensive, however, the grooves in the mounting plate attached to the jack are not very compatible with most trailers. If you tighten the bolts too tightly, the wheel will be difficult to move to the up/down position for transporting the trailer. I think that some slight modifications could make it a little more universal but, other than that, it works well. Don't forget to grease it with a grease gun for the best life expectancy.
customer_reviews.author: Dom

customer_reviews.title: As is when I need to move the boat around there is so much play on the snap ring the jack looks like it's going to pop off at an
customer_reviews.text: Little wobbly on the snap ring. Wish I'd ordered the Fulton with the double wheel for easier maneuvering. As is when I need to move the boat around there is so much play on the snap ring the jack looks like it's going to pop off at any moment. It hasn't! But still a little un-nerving
customer_reviews.author: Dave Greenman

customer_reviews.title: Fulton Trailer Jack on Pop Up
customer_reviews.text: The Fulton 1200 has so far exceeded my expectations. The unit is very heavy duty. It bolted on easily with no problem onto my popup trailer. The function of the jack is very smooth, much better than the one it replaced. For the price and quality of this product it is an exceptional value. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KeithR

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great...EZ to install!
customer_reviews.text: Put it on my boat to replace a rusted Jack. Took longer to remove the old one! Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Waller

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I thought for the price of this item that it would probably be a joke but it is a very good jack. I use it on an ATV trailer and it makes moving the trailer around easy. The swivel seems to be very sturdy and also the wheel seems to be sturdy. I think it would work well on a larger trailer. It is very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Use this on my 13 foot Scotty travel trailer and ...
customer_reviews.text: Use this on my 13 foot Scotty travel trailer and it is just the right size. No more getting stuck in loose gravel with the old one. Now I can handle biscotti by myself. That is a big plus
customer_reviews.author: karla lamb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, works great for my trailer I can roll ...
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 5 stars only because their isn't 6 stars. Excellent, works great for my trailer I can roll it around on dirt ,grass and cement. Super sturdy. Cranks so easy.
customer_reviews.author: ronkar

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: This product looks like it is built well and the install took less than 15 min . It works as advertised , I would recommend it and I don't think I will be using the 5 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle G

customer_reviews.title: Back saver.
customer_reviews.text: This makes moving the trailer a snap. Very well made and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: OhioJennie

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE! Fulton is not what it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Owned several of these in the past and had no problems. Received this one and tolerances are sloppy, making the jack unusable. The wheel walks away from the frame when jacked enough to remove from my stock height truck.... so much that I fear it falling on my foot and will be getting something else. Took the mounting plate off three times and confirmed it was mounted correctly with a level. Problem is sloppy tolerance within the snap ring, as others have said. Buy at your own risk. Cheap Chinese junk.
customer_reviews.author: Big C

customer_reviews.title: Good solid tongue jack
customer_reviews.text: Used this for our utility trailer. It's extremely sturdy and strong.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Fulton Trialer Jack
customer_reviews.text: Works on my Tracker boat trailer. Only thing is if it's cranked up high the handle nut hits my boat hull. I just make sure the wheel points to the inside so it pushes the handle away from the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Zuko

customer_reviews.title: Made right
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace a non tilting trailer jack that came with the trailer. Works much better. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Price

customer_reviews.title: Works great and was a great replacement for my old one ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great and was a great replacement for my old one that lasted about 15 years. Make sure you grease it and it should last.
customer_reviews.author: Texicali

customer_reviews.title: Best trailer jack for your money.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome trailer jack! I've bought others before and this one is the best.
customer_reviews.author: David Stiles

customer_reviews.title: So Happy with FULTON
customer_reviews.text: They didn't change this jack mount from 1998, so the new one when right on to the original mount. All I had to do was pull off the snap ring from the broken jack and put this new one on by reinstalling the new snap ring. It takes some patience getting the ring on and off, but it's not that hard. It's nice to have a smooth cranking jack again. I recommend for boat owners.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Piazza

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and operation
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, strong, smooth jacking and very easy swivel. Instructions are a bit confusing, because they try to cover many different models of jacks in a single flyer. But, it isn't exactly brain surgery; you'll figure it out, and all the parts are there.
customer_reviews.author: Costero

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works well on my trailer, can now open the tailgate on the pickup with the trailer attached
customer_reviews.author: Ernest R. Forrey

customer_reviews.title: Attached to camper easy enough, jack works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and in condition described. Would purchase from seller again. Attached to camper easy enough, jack works like a dream. No issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Way more Jack then I'll ever need.
customer_reviews.text: I only just put it on, but it is way more than I would probably ever need on my 8 x 10 landscaping trailer.
customer_reviews.author: TheDentist

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My jacks usually last about 8 months with heavy salt water use. This jack seems like it'll out perform others. Plus I now wd40 the hell out of it before and after use
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Dennison

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it bolts are placed properly
customer_reviews.text: As my trailer is constructed of angle iron, I had to cut thick metal to place in the section of angle iron prior to assembly so I could adequately tighten down the jack to the trailer. Seems to hold up to plenty of weight even under around a ton of soil in the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin D. Newsome

customer_reviews.title: Well Constructed Tongue Jack
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed tongue jack. Snap ring allows you to replace your worn out, welded on swivel jack. Clear instructions if you're undertaking a new install (i.e., bolt on).
customer_reviews.author: SoCalNel

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack
customer_reviews.text: This Jack makes raising and lowering my boat 5 times easier than the old "doghouse gear" style, a true time and arm saver.
customer_reviews.author: mark mayfield

customer_reviews.title: Good Jack
customer_reviews.text: It really wasn't designed to become the "nose wheel" for personal boat launching. After reading lots of reviews I thought it might be strong enough to manage the job. It was.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur David Digby

customer_reviews.title: Works Well and Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Works well. This is my second unit and the first lasted 10 years until I forgot to latch it horizontal, drove over a hump and destroyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Thomas

customer_reviews.title: I don't get great service life from these units
customer_reviews.text: works; replaces an existing one. I don't get great service life from these units, but I do use them in salt water a lot. I'm trying to remember to flush these with fresh water every time to see if that helps extend their life.
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy, functional replacement trailer tongue jack.
customer_reviews.text: Just the ticket to replace my old jack that had failed. Package includes all necessary bolts and nut and the new jack was on and functioning appropriately in just a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Budster

customer_reviews.title: 4 Star product
customer_reviews.text: Got exactly what I ordered and will do the job just great. The only reason it does not get a 5th star is due to the free movement in a lot of the parts. There is a gap between the wheel bearing sleeve and also a quite a bit of movement between the gears inside. I would recommended this product.
customer_reviews.author: DaRosa

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly and is a great value. Make sure you tighten the handle because ...
customer_reviews.text: works perfectly and is a great value. Make sure you tighten the handle because it fell off ,but it was my mistake so I still gave it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ted  Mottola

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Solid and works great. Really like the grease fitting. Never had one with that.
customer_reviews.author: Ken K

customer_reviews.title: Made like older models
customer_reviews.text: Same as my old Fulton on my boat trailer.old back plate was welded to trailer frame,removed snap ring and mounted to old plate.perfect fit
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Porter

customer_reviews.title: SeaDoo trailer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this not knowing really if it would fit my SeaDoo trailer but I was pleasantly surprised that it fit perfectly. It seems to be built fairly heavy and works like a charm. I would highly recommend it for small boat trailers or utility trailers.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Are the price this is a pretty good Jack. It does have a pretty massive lean to it though.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Pregler

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works good. I think my trailer is a little to heavy for it since it's hard to make it move around but then again it's on a dual axel so that could be it too.but I am happy with it and it works as it should
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: decent, might last 2 years in salty environs
customer_reviews.text: standard jack, make sure to mount it properly so it doesnt roll off the frame
customer_reviews.author: CD Goshorn

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: as with all fulton products I have purchased, very good
customer_reviews.author: Lw G.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. The metal is a bit flimsey so I dont put much sideways pressure on it while moving it. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Lift no more, forever more.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to be able to move my heavy utility trailer around in my yard, and this does the trick. A little push, a little shove, and the trailer moves almost by itself. Good heavy duty unit.
customer_reviews.author: William B. Kennett

customer_reviews.title: Great product from Fulton.
customer_reviews.text: Again it is a Fulton. Excelent upgrade for my tracker bass boat.
customer_reviews.author: Darold G. Dahse

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works perfectly. Only complaint is on install you needed leverage to put screws in and some were recessed and hard to get to.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Chinique

customer_reviews.title: FULTON TRAILER JACK
customer_reviews.text: THIS ITEM IS HEAVY AND DOES THE JOB VERY NICELY. I HAD BOUGHT A JACK FROM HARBOR FREIGHT, WHICH ALMOST COST AS MUCH AS THIS ONE, AND IN A FEW MONTHS TIME IT WAS IN THE GARBAGE. THIS IS A BUY ITEM.
customer_reviews.author: TIMEOUT

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. I've placed it on an 8' box trailer and it works great. So easy to roll the trailer around now.
customer_reviews.author: Dustan Balkcom

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Easy to install. I am extremely satisfied. Swivels up and out of the way. I recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: DBlock

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY MATCHES PRICE
customer_reviews.text: For the price of this jack it is a good value. It was easy to install and does the job. However, the wheel does not swivel easily as the shaft ends up at an angle to the the surface - not perpendicular. I used to use a stump and four chocks to park the trailer, and this jack has made the process much easier. I also don't have to carry stumps and chocks around all the time. And, I can hitch the trailer to my rig when it's loaded, which I could only do before with a crowbar and a lot of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Adipose Whistlethwaite

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The gears have been smooth and putting irt in my trailer was simple with the different brackets supplied.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Smolinski

customer_reviews.title: but this one is great for me
customer_reviews.text: Just what my little whaler needed. Heavier boat would use a bottom plate support and not a side bolted one, but this one is great for me, tilt wheel is a good feature
customer_reviews.author: ken d stephens

customer_reviews.title: Tough tongue jack!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, gets the job done-I stripped my last (weaker) one lifting a trailer with a heavy tongue weight, this one lifted 1200+ pounds easily with no damage.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Blomer

customer_reviews.title: If it holds up I will be pleased.
customer_reviews.text: It cranks real smooth. If it holds up I will be pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Wessinger

customer_reviews.title: Very simple, yet strong!!
customer_reviews.text: Very good for the price, installed very quickly and works excellent. The only complaint that I have is that the mounting bolts are quite long. Construction is good all very solid all the way around. A nice bonus is the grease fitting by the handle that some other jacks don't have. Very little play with over 500LBS on it. Overall I would definitely recommend this item to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: PER P.

customer_reviews.title: This is a better jack. I had bought a $25 one from ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a better jack. I had bought a $25 one from Harbor Freight and it lasted about 1 year. This one works much more smoothly and seems to be a higher quality and has an extra 200 lbs rating over the 1000 lb one I bought previously.
customer_reviews.author: Gib Royal

customer_reviews.title: Not pleased
customer_reviews.text: Have 17 ft Tracker. Boat. Wheel does not swivel when moving boat.
customer_reviews.author: BILL TAYLOR

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Completely as represented. Quality construction. Easy to install, all necessary hardware included.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Annett

customer_reviews.title: works great. easy to install took
customer_reviews.text: replacement for rusted out one. works great. easy to install took minutes
customer_reviews.author: John Michael Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Works great, had to replace the old fulton that was ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, had to replace the old fulton that was on my trailer. The last one lasted 17 years so hopefully this one will too. The installation was very easy and works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: peter lauman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My old jack handle broke, this bolted on in 10 minutes and has worked for me without any issues
customer_reviews.author: John F Voris

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace our trailer jack, this was easy to install and works great!
customer_reviews.author: KMM

customer_reviews.title: Four stars for a tongue jack of any kind....
customer_reviews.text: It's what we wanted, and it arrived very quickly--at the right price. Nothing more can be said about such a mundane widget.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie brooklyn girl

customer_reviews.title: Fulton a name you can trust
customer_reviews.text: They recommend you go anywhere from 10% to 15% of your total weight and this baby does the job. Has a grease fitting and lifts my boat the highest out of them all. These beasts last almost 14 years.
customer_reviews.author: Saltymomus

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on a medium size trailer for our 10' sailing dinghy and it works very well although, as design it is limited to medium loads.
customer_reviews.author: Klintehamn

customer_reviews.title: good deal
customer_reviews.text: Received and installed today. Im liking it so far Easy to install, works well on my 18' 1200lb boat trailer.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: The make these cheaper and cheaper I suggest using 2x ...
customer_reviews.text: The make these cheaper and cheaper I suggest using 2x the capacity you need to avoid the thing stressing
customer_reviews.author: r benedetto

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased to replace a very old boat trailer jack. This seems to be of good quality, and installed quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Chopper

customer_reviews.title: Good Porduct
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good trailer jack. Fit my 22' boat trailer just fine. Really like the grease port makes lubing the jack so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Dawnjuly2

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to install and is very easy to operate. Well built. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: T. H. Frazer

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! This jack has been damaged and sold used as in good shape. Not hardly! The center pivot has a loose connection to the center and leans like a kick stand. If I can get my money back etc... blah blah It sucks!
customer_reviews.author: StaceyLaw

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very sturdy comapared to my last jack. fits just right and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: robert halter

customer_reviews.title: quality workmanship & able configure to work on my integrated sea ray trailer
customer_reviews.text: After 16 years my fulton jack failed so I needed a replacement. My trailer for my 23 foot sea ray had the trailer jack integrated in the frame. I was able to get this jack to fit in the original spot on trailer; i was so happy
customer_reviews.author: gmc boy

customer_reviews.title: Everything I expected
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a small boat trailer and does exactly what was expected. I did swop out four bolts and locking nuts provided for four bolts of slightly longer length as my trailer frame required a bit more length to secure. Not a big deal and a minor added expense that I think vast majority of users will not experience. My install was a bit unique. My only wish is someone would design a similar unit either a neumatic tire that would cope with gravel road. These are great on blacktop or concrete surfaces but do not roll easily on dirt and gravel roads.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Graham

customer_reviews.title: Perfect jack for my 2-place snowmobile trailer
customer_reviews.text: Great product, seems well built for my use. Seller was quick with shipping
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A Laplante

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware. Seller shipped a used jack.
customer_reviews.text: Seller shipped me a used part. The box was poorly re-tapped and the jack had obviously been exposed to the weather. After installing and cranking it down, I noticed rust on the inner pipe. Is Amazon going to be a clearing house for returns? At least 50% of my marine parts orders have been returns, even though they are sold as new. Waste of money. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Olaf Shadetree

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fit onto my trailer like a breeze! Pulled the snap ring and slipped it right on. Just like OEM!
customer_reviews.author: Ab

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was simple to install and just what I needed to move the trailer around!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Cooper

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. I replaced the jack on my boat trailer and it was easy to bolt on and came with all hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great and no issues with a 6 ton boat on trailer!
customer_reviews.author: Harnessone

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Our last Fulton survived 18 yrs of heavy work with an 18' ski boat, and probably was damaged due to my own stupidity. Love these jacks. Tough. Easy to install. Workhorses. The real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Guenther

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement on a boat trailer, make sure to grease it up
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my 18ft runabout trailer, the boat's about 1000 pounds I'm not sure about tongue weight. At first I was not impressed, it seemed to not want to spin but once I shot it with grease it has been working fine. I greased both on the zirk fitting that comes on it and I opened the top and fed some grease in there too.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Jack
customer_reviews.text: I should have ordered this jack right off the bat. I tried other less expensive jacks rated anywhere from 800 lbs to 1200 lbs - they were poorly constructed and did not do the job. This one has the others beet hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good except for the grease fitting is weak.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. Works well and installed easily. It has a grease fitting and that's a nice feature but the fitting broke off the very first time I put a grease gun on it after install. Two pumps and it snapped off like it was made of glass. Funny how this simple, nice feature, spoiled my otherwise good product review. Other than the cheap grease fitting, it's a nice trailer jack for the money.
customer_reviews.author: KXrider

customer_reviews.title: Trailer Jack
customer_reviews.text: Swivel Jack arrived as promised no issues here, the item looks sturdy especially the trailer bracket. I will fit and hopefully it will last more than a couple of seasons. Recommended for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rooster

product_meta.title: Fulton TJ12000101 Swivel Trailer Tongue Jack, 1200 Lbs. Capacity
product_meta.description: Fulton TJ1200 Trailer Jack is designed for use with marine and utility trailers. Fulton brand tongue jacks are time-tested and application-proven. Features Z-MAX 600 Superior Plating corrosion protection. Bolt-on, includes all necessary mounting hardware and 3/8" pull pin. Sturdy 6" Poly wheel. The Fulton brand retaining ring swivel mount offers minimal deflection and maximum support. Mount fits up to a 3" x 5" trailer frame. Capacity: 1200 lbs., Travel: 10", Retracted Length: 12.7", Extended Length: 22.7" (Measured Center of Mount to Bottom of Wheel) Top Clearance: 11.4" (Measured Center of Mount to Top of Jack)
feature_bullets: Bolt-On Swivel Tongue Jack, 1200 lbs. capacity
Sturdy 6" Poly wheel, 3/8" swivel pull pin
Hardware included to mount up to a 3" x 5" trailer frame
